page.title: 15The Railway in Sidcup Area.
page.content: The railway was{responsible for the {development of the area,}built in the 1930's. It runs from Dartford to London. It mainly provides transport into London for commuters, living in this area. Most of the{commuters}get off at Canon Street Station, which is in the centre of London, thus only has offices nearby and so is only open Monday to Friday. Other London Stations which are busy with commuters and shoppers are: Charing Cross, Waterloo East and London Bridge. {Train passes}are quite common, to avoid the queues as well as to save money. In September 1985 the train pass will have to be accompanied with a{photocard for identifcation.}This is already compulsory for bus passes.
